message.content:
cs.DL, cs.IR, cs.SI, cs.SD, cs.CY 

This paper is about a software tool for analyzing and visualizing citation networks of scientific publications. The tool can be used to study the development of a research field, to delineate the literature on a research topic, and to support literature reviewing. The paper discusses technical details on the construction, visualization, and analysis of citation networks. Based on this, the most likely arXiv CS sub-categories are cs.DL (Digital Libraries), cs.IR (Information Retrieval), cs.SI (Social and Information Networks), cs.SD (Software Engineering), and cs.CY (Computers and Society).
